alert.note: Alert for Wayne (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued March 18 at 6:39AM CDT until March 18 at 12:45PM CDT by NWS Mobile
info.description: The National Weather Service in Mobile has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Wayne County in southeastern Mississippi... * Until 1245 PM CDT Friday. * At 639 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 2 to 4 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. This flash flooding threat will likely spread south to along the Highway 84 corridor, especially from Waynesboro and points west. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Waynesboro, Clara, Woodwards, West King, Whistler, Boice, Hiwannee, Winchester, Strengthford, Hollis Creek, Denham, Eucutta, Lightsey and Gretna. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
